item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Monday, February 17, 2025 at 4:20 AM UTC
item.description:
1. Uchū – Color scheme for internet lovers (308 points | 127 comments)
2. Homemade polarimetric synthetic aperture radar drone (57 points | 7 comments)
3. “A calculator app? Anyone could make that” (1314 points | 331 comments)
4. All Kindles can now be jailbroken (129 points | 56 comments)
5. San Francisco homelessness: Park ranger helps one person at a time (83 points | 101 comments)
6. Does or did COBOL default to 1875-05-20 for corrupt or missing dates? (52 points | 70 comments)
7. MySQL at Uber (13 points | 2 comments)
8. Opposing arrows of time can theoretically emerge from certain quantum systems (45 points | 43 comments)

10. Show HN: Air traffic control radio and chill music for focus (118 points | 68 comments)
11. Genesis and Sega CD – Audio Filtering (17 points | 1 comment)

13. IPv6 Is Hard (131 points | 208 comments)
14. YouTube asks channel owner to verify phone, permanently overwrites personal info (96 points | 69 comments)
15. Extreme supersonic winds measured on a planet outside our solar system (10 points | 5 comments)
16. Ugandan runner Jacob Kiplimo completes first ever sub-57 minute half marathon (24 points | 6 comments)

19. Publish Your Gaussian Splats with SuperSplat (22 points | 3 comments)

21. Half-Life 2 and Dishonored art lead Viktor Antonov has died (404 points | 80 comments)
22. Did the Windows 95 setup team forget that MS-DOS can do graphics? (40 points | 12 comments)
23. The human mind is in a recession (23 points | 16 comments)
24. OpenVINO AI effects [denoising and transcription] for Audacity (114 points | 23 comments)
25. United States Power Outage Map (259 points | 126 comments)
26. Oklch in CSS: why we moved from RGB and HSL (2024) (38 points | 13 comments)
27. Root-inspired additive printing for fabricating robust conformal electronics (13 points | discuss)
28. When Not to Obey Orders (2019) (23 points | 2 comments)
29. Trick to find commands in the terminal quickly (58 points | 62 comments)
30. Why bother with privacy when I have nothing to hide? (2023) (53 points | 49 comments)
